intro: Drypetes microphylloides, commonly known as the small-leaf drypetes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions such as Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
